metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5803 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
In the Linux Kernel before version 4.15.8, 4.14.25, 4.9.87, 4.4.121,4.1.51, and 3.2.102, an error in the "_sctp_make_chunk()" function(net/sctp/sm_make_chunk.c) when handling SCTP packets length can beexploited to cause a kernel crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5803` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-13-generic - 4.15.0-13.14
linux-image-4.15.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-13.14
linux-image-4.15.0-13-lowlatency - 4.15.0-13.14
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-13-generic - 4.15.0-13.14
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1006-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1006.7
No subscription required
